Message:
In the forest at
the rendezvous point.

Awaiting the crunch of
my footsteps in the snow
was the sound of
a single gunshot.

Magic energy radiates from
the bullet that just shot
into the wall behind me.
My opponent is a witch.

“You did well.
But, your job ends here.”

As though lurking in
the surrounding shadows,
the voice of an Inquisitor
also reaches my ears.

In that moment,
everything became clear.
I had served my purpose.

In other words...
my sister was already...
No... She’s probably been
dead from the start...!

If... If I just
made it through this list...
they said they’d give
my sister back to me...!

I don’t want to remember
what happened after that.

After shooting the legs
of the fleeing Inquisitor,
all I know is that I shot
countless rounds into
his skull as he begged for mercy.

When I came to, before my eyes
lied the gun-wielding witch
collapsed on her side.

She had lost conciousness,
but her wounds were shallow,
and she was still breathing.
Thank goodness...

—I didn’t want to have
any more witches’ blood
on my hands...
